content: Turning to Slide 6, broad-based loan growth continued and exceeded expectations with average balances increasing $1.3 billion or 2.5%. Elevated interest rates, lack of housing inventory, and normal seasonality, continued to pressure mortgage banker as average loans declined $329 million for the quarter. Our 2023 expenses are expected to grow 7% or 4% on an adjusted basis, excluding the $64 million increase in pension, a $19 million reduction in modernization charges and assuming the $18 million in deferred comp benefit does not repeat.
